body:
The repository used by the texlive installer defaults to a redirector that sends one off to various URLs depending on <fill in the blank>.

This is problematic because all of the mirrors do not update in synchrony and bad tarballs often hang around for a while.

This leads to problems that are particularly hard to diagnose because you're likely to end up using a different repo the next time around.

This commit constraints the package to a particular, mainstream, repository.  It's not fast, but it's consistent and usually correct.

It also updates the installer digest, because no day is complete without updating it at least (sigh) once.

[what @tgamblin wants, @tgamblin gets... :smile:]
title: Force particular texlive repo to increase predictability
